title: Japan Trip Planning - Cherry Blossom Itinerary & Hotels
user_intent: Plan a 7-day trip to Japan during cherry blossom season, including hotel recommendations and a draft itinerary for Tokyo and Kyoto.
what_we_did: Provided 3 hotel options for Tokyo (Shinjuku, Shibuya areas) and 2 for Kyoto (Gion, Central).
Drafted a 7-day itinerary: 3 days Tokyo, 3 days Kyoto, 1 travel day.
Included popular cherry blossom viewing spots and suggested transportation (Shinkansen).
what_worked: User appreciated the hotel suggestions, especially the focus on location and boutique style.
The basic itinerary structure was well-received.
Successfully identified key cherry blossom viewing periods.
what_failed: User found the itinerary a bit too generic and wanted more unique, less touristy experiences.
Did not provide specific booking links for hotels.
Struggled to integrate user's dietary restrictions (vegetarian) into food recommendations.
constraints: Dates: Late March - Early April (cherry blossom season).
preferences: Prefers boutique hotels over large chains.
Likes cultural experiences and local food markets.
next_steps: Refine itinerary with more unique, less touristy activities.
Provide booking links or options for selected hotels.
instructions_for_next_model: Prioritize unique, local experiences for the itinerary, avoiding common tourist traps.
Ensure all food recommendations are explicitly vegetarian and provide specific restaurant suggestions.
Research and provide direct booking links for boutique hotels within the specified budget.
Ask the user about specific interests (e.g., art, history, nature) to further personalize the itinerary.
